meanings.definition: Not having been evaluated or assessed.
meanings.sent1: The unjudged painting sat quietly in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The unjudged project was left untouched on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The unjudged cake looked so tempting, but no one dared to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her unjudged talent shone brightly in the school play.
meanings.sent5: The unjudged garden was a hidden gem waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: Not having been criticized or condemned.
meanings.sent1: The unjudged behavior of the child surprised the teacher.
meanings.sent2: The unjudged book received praise from all who read it.
meanings.sent3: His unjudged outfit was a mix of colors that somehow worked perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The unjudged speech left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The unjudged decision turned out to be the best one made that day.

meanings.definition: Not having been decided or determined.
meanings.sent1: The unjudged winner of the contest will be announced tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The unjudged date for the event caused uncertainty among the attendees.
meanings.sent3: The unjudged route to take left them lost in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His unjudged future was full of endless possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The unjudged outcome kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
